title: Dominican Republic: Citi Holds Ninth Annual Microentrepreneurship Awards
summary: Santo Domingo - Citi Dominican Republic, in collaboration with its local partner, Consejo de Fundaciones Americanas de Desarrollo (Solidarios), held the ninth annual edition of the "Citi Microentrepreneurship Awards," designed to recognize microentrepreneurs who have had a positive social and economic impact in their communities and helped inspire the creation of similar enterprises.
tag-1: Dominican Republic: Citi Holds Ninth Annual Microentrepreneurship Awards
tag-3: Santo Domingo – Citi Dominican Republic, in collaboration with its local partner, Consejo de Fundaciones Americanas de Desarrollo (Solidarios), held the ninth annual edition of the "Citi Microentrepreneurship Awards," designed to recognize microentrepreneurs who have had a positive social and economic impact in their communities and helped inspire the creation of similar enterprises.
tag-4: Máximo Vidal, General Manager of Citi Dominican Republic, described the awards as an example of Citi's commitment to contribute to the development of the communities where it operates. "This project offers us the opportunity to recognize the extraordinary efforts of entrepreneurs in their communities and to raise awareness of the importance of this sector's growth in the country's economy," he explained.
tag-5: As part of its commitment to Responsible Finance, the bank supports a range of projects through the Citi Foundation to strengthen the microentrepreneurial and microfinance sectors, which it views as possible solutions for reducing the economic inequalities that characterize Latin America, and the Dominican Republic in particular.
tag-6: The awards honor microentrepreneurs in the following categories: Microenterprise - Young Entrepreneurs, Microenterprise – Individual Initiatives, Microenterprise – Environmental Protection and Improvement, Microenterprise – Family Run, Microenterprise – Agriculture and Livestock, and Microenterprise – Education. In addition to a first prize for Microenterprise of the Year, the contest included awards for outstanding microentrepreneurs not classified within the established categories and a special award for the most innovative financial institution.
tag-7: In addition to the prizes they receive at the awards ceremony, two of the winners will be chosen to participate in a regional training event in Costa Rica in the second half of 2014. The event, held this year in Buenos Aires, Argentina, offers intensive training in business management, commercialization of products and services, and sales strategies. This year's participants included winners of the Citi Microentrepreneurship Awards from eight countries in the region, including one from the Dominican Republic.
tag-8: The judges' committee responsible for selecting the winners of the 2013 Citi Microentrepreneurship Awards in the Dominican Republic includes Elena Viyella de Paliza, President, EDUCA; Central Bank Treasurer Carolina Ramos; Lilliana Cruz, Project Director, AMCHAM-DR; Enrique Fernández, Executive President, ACOFAVE; Mario Dávalos, President, Fondomicro; Marina Ortiz, Executive Director, Fondomicro; Rosa Rita Álvarez, Executive Director, Fundación Reserva del País; Ignacio Méndez, Vice Minister of SME Promotion; and Inter-American Development Bank (IADB) representative Flora Montealegro Painter.
tag-9: Citi launched the Microentrepreneurship Awards in the Dominican Republic in 2005 as part of its commitment to the economic growth of families and individuals and financial education. To date, the bank offers the awards in more than 30 countries around the world and has presented approximately US$5.5 million to almost 5,000 microentrepreneurs.
tag-10: Citi Citi, the leading global bank, has approximately 200 million customer accounts and does business in more than 160 countries and jurisdictions. Citi provides consumers, corporations, governments and institutions with a broad range of financial products and services, including consumer banking and credit, corporate and investment banking, securities brokerage, transaction services, and wealth management.

tag-12: The Citi Foundation The Citi Foundation is committed to the economic empowerment and financial inclusion of individuals and families, particularly those in need, in the communities where we work so that they can improve their standard of living. Globally, the Citi Foundation targets its strategic giving to priority focus areas: Microfinance, Enterprise Development, Youth Education and Livelihoods, and Financial Capability and Asset Building. The Citi Foundation works with its partners in Microfinance and Enterprise Development to support environmental programs and innovations. Additional information can be found at www.citifoundation.com.
tag-13: Consejo de Fundaciones Americanas de Desarrollo (SOLIDARIOS) Consejo de Fundaciones Americanas de Desarrollo (SOLIDARIOS) is a network of development foundations serving the region for more than 35 years. As of December 2010, it served approximately 800,500 microentrepreneurs in 10 countries. Its mission is to contribute to social and economic development in Latin American and Caribbean countries via its member institutions, which are dedicated to promoting progress for the most vulnerable populations in their respective countries by coordinating and channeling institutional efforts.
